Text.Value: Otherwise you might have a gut explosion on your hands.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Text.Value: Tell you what, I'll throw one in for free with your purchase - limited time offer.
They're particularly good at cleaning - especially food disposal.
I can tell you're a discerning customer - you're after nothing but the best.
It's very much a case of summoner error when it does - not our spellwork.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Text.Value: Gods, but it stinks! And it looks like somebody melted most of its flesh off.
Word of warning, mind: make sure you empty them frequently.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Text.Value: It looks a little fragile to me...
Just think of the possibilities once you have a fresh, high-quality, completely safe zombie at your disposal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confident salesman patter - keen to emphasise how safe the zombie definitely i

Text.Value: Just in case what?
Oh. they excel at all those humdrum menial chores.
Now, now - you and I both know that being undead takes a toll on a corpse.
So what can it do? I've a lot of domestic tasks that are quite frankly beneath me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Contemplatively; haughty at the idea of doing said tasks herself

Text.Value: I'd be a laughing stock with that lumbering 'round after me.
One more thing: I recommend getting at least a couple of scrolls of Turn Undead just in case.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's saying

Text.Value: They also make excellent low-cost bodyguards - and you can't be too careful with the way things are going.
Not very. But it might.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Text.Value: They won't be trespassing anywhere else in a hurry! Or walking at all, for that matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; definitely not acknowledging the sinister undertone here

Text.Value: We also do a range of fetching liveries and complimentary perfume spritzers - all seasonal, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; keen to emphasise how good of a deal this is

Text.Value: ...And everywhere else, really.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Text.Value: Nonsense! They're tougher than they look. Plus, even if they lose a limb, they keep on going.
Oh. Does that happen very often?
And luckily for you, that's exactly what I have - the best necromantic charms in the city or your money back!
It is rather a pain to clean up after dinner parties...
Empty them? How? Oh. You know what - I'm not sure I want to know.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly disgusted the more she thinks about it

Text.Value: I... I'll think about it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Kind of against buying one of these zombies now

Text.Value: Complimentary, you say?
I sold one to a wonderful old gent for property protection.
I see...
They'll happily eat anything you put in front of them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; definitely not acknowledging the sinister undertone here

Text.Value: A trespasser chopped its arms off but it still chewed right through their ankles.
Just in case you happen to lose control of your shiny new servant.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

Synopsis: An repeated AD conversation between a vendor in the necromantic area of the shop and a potential customer. When a player gets close the vendor resurrects a body in gameplay with Raise Dead and starts this dialog.
